LAST_MODIFIED

See Also:
Constant Field Values

filesToUpload

private UploadFileData[] filesToUpload
This array will contain a 'copy' of the relevant element of the filesDataParam array (see the constructor). After filling the filesToUpload array, the UploadThread will only manipulate it: all access to the file contained by the filesDataParam given to the constructor will be done through the UploadFileData contained by this array.

uploadPolicy

private UploadPolicy uploadPolicy
The upload policy contains all parameters needed to define the way files should be uploaded, including the URL.

progress

private javax.swing.JProgressBar progress
The progress bar, that will indicate to the user the upload state (0 to 100%).

totalFilesLength

private long totalFilesLength
The total number of bytes to be sent. This allows the calculation of the progress bar

uploadedLength

private long uploadedLength
Current number of byts that have been uploaded.

stop

boolean stop
If set to 'true', the thread will stop the crrent upload. This attribute is not private as the UploadFileData class us it.

See Also:
UploadFileData.uploadFile(java.io.OutputStream)

sbServerOutput

private java.lang.StringBuffer sbServerOutput
Server Output. It can then be displayed in the status bar, if debug is enabled. It is stored by DefaultUploadPolicy in a string buffer, so that all debug output can be sent to the webmaster, if an error occurs.

uploadException

private java.lang.Exception uploadException
Thread Exception, if any occured during upload.

nbBytesUploaded

public void nbBytesUploaded(long nbBytes)
Description copied from interface: FileUploadThread
Indicate to the UploadThread that nbBytes bytes have been uploaded to the server. It's up to this method to change the display on the progress bar (or whatever other information displayed to the user)

Specified by:
nbBytesUploaded in interface FileUploadThread

clearServerOutPut

private void clearServerOutPut()
Clear the StringBuffer that contains the serverOutput. Called before each HTTP request.

Parameters:

getRandomString

private java.lang.String getRandomString()
Construction of a random string, to separate the uploaded files, in the HTTP upload request.

setAllHead

private java.lang.String[] setAllHead(int firstFileToUpload,
                                      int nbFilesToUpload,
                                      java.lang.String bound)
                               throws JUploadException
Construction of the head for each file.

Parameters:
firstFileToUpload - The index of the first file to upload, in the filesToUpload area.
nbFilesToUpload - Number of file to upload, in the next HTTP upload request. These files are taken from the filesToUpload area
bound - The String boundary between the post data in the HTTP request.
Returns:
HTTP header for each file, within the multipart HTTP request.
Throws:
JUploadException

setAllTail

private java.lang.String[] setAllTail(int firstFileToUpload,
                                      int nbFilesToUpload,
                                      java.lang.String bound)
Construction of the tail for each file.

Parameters:
firstFileToUpload - The index of the first file to upload, in the filesToUpload area.
nbFilesToUpload - Number of file to upload, in the next HTTP upload request. These files are taken from the filesToUpload area
bound -
Returns:
Returns an array containing the HTTP tails for al files of the current HTTP request.

run

public void run()
The heart of the program. This method prepare the upload, then calls doUpload for each HTTP request.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

doUpload

private boolean doUpload(int firstFileToUpload,
                         int nbFilesToUpload)
Actual execution file upload. It's called by the run methods, once for all files, or file by file, depending on the UploadPolicy.

Parameters:
firstFileToUpload - The index of the first file to upload, in the filesToUpload area.
nbFilesToUpload - Number of file to upload, in the next HTTP upload request. These files are taken from the filesToUpload area

public void close()
Some internal attributes are set to null.

close in interface FileUploadThread
